newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek OTE picks Ericsson for DECT 1800 system.
newsitem.headline: Greek OTE picks Ericsson for DECT 1800 system.

text.p: The board of directors of Greek telecoms company OTE decided on Tuesday to sign a contract with the Ericsson Group to receive supplies of the fixed wireless telephone system DECT 1800, it said in a statement.
This digital telephone system is a pioneering European system that uses the 1800-1900 Mhz frequencey band and has indoor applications, it said.
OTE estimates DECT 1800 sales to reach 300 million drachmas in the next three years. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
